result.execSummary:
The defendant Henry L Nelson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail on deposit to be applied to Cost/Surcharge.  Remaining balance to be paid as a condition of probation.
AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment recommended.  Comply with random urine screens.   No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.  Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.  

Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Court grants 8 days credit.  TIME SERVED

03:06 PM Defendant Henry L Nelson in court with attorney Broze and attorney  Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.    Victim rights have been complied with by the Waukesha County District Attorneys Office.
Court conducts plea colloquy with defendant. 
Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count 1. 
Court finds the defendant guilty to Count 1. 
Court dismisses and reads in Case 17CF521.

Court orders the following:
30 DAYS  Waukesha County Jail with Huber, all standard release conditions.
STAYED for PROBATION

Term of Probation: 1 YEAR
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Follow through with any assessments, evaluations, treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent; 
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done.

COSTS:  $243.00
DNA SAMPLE AND SURCHARGE:  $200.00 (to be paid as a condition of probation);
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.
To be paid as a Condition of Probation.

CONDITION TIME: 8 DAYS Waukesha County Jail, with Huber, all standard release conditions 8 Days Credit TIME SERVED  

Any monies posted to be used towards costs/surcharge in this matter.
